image.altText: Jason Mcmahon was one of two people who died in a multi-car crash near Lithgow.

props.synopsis: Jason Mcmahon, 49, was one of two men who died on the Great Western Highway at Wallerawang, in a five-car crash that injured 15 others, including five children on Friday.

title.children: 'Great mate and great dad': Tributes flow for Sydney man who died in multi-car crash near Lithgow

image.altText: A flat lay of different contraception methods.

props.synopsis: The culmination of birth control content on social media gives the distinct impression that young women today are well and truly fed up with the pill. In Australia, however, the research suggests a different reality.

title.children: What once was liberation is now often seen as a burden: Australia's complicated relationship with the pill

image.altText: a few cars seen damaged and on fire with billowing smoke

props.synopsis: Russian officials accuse Ukraine of carrying out shelling on the Russian border city of Belgorod, killing 14 people, a day after Russia's 18-hour aerial assault on Ukraine.

title.children: Russia blames Ukraine as 14 killed in shelling on Belgorod city

image.altText: Storm clouds fill the skies above Brisbane

props.synopsis: Queenslanders are being urged to remain vigilant across the weekend, with destructive wind gusts, giant hail, heavy rainfall and flash flooding predicted.

title.children: Two people struck by lightning as wild weather threatens storm-ravaged Queensland and NSW

image.altText: A composite photo of Australian and Chinese flags combined with a grain photo overlaid

props.synopsis: Farmers say it took time to bounce back from China's tariffs on Australian barley, but the reopening of the market has been positive.

title.children: China's appetite for Australian barley is back, three years after tariffs halted the market

image.altText: Karen Armanasco stands behind a counter laden with medications and over-the-counter pharmacy products.

props.synopsis: Prescriptions may be subsidised but the cost of over-the-counter pharmacy products is adding up for the chronically ill.

title.children: Having cancer has cost Karen more than $10,000 and the monthly pharmacy bills keep adding up

image.altText: A young Nepalese man wearing a purple BBL uniform as well as a gold chain and white watch looks intense on a cricket field.

props.synopsis: The 23-year-old Lamichhane was suspended as Nepal's cricket captain last year and taken into custody after police issued an arrest warrant for him over the assault in 2022.

title.children: Former BBL player Sandeep Lamichhane found guilty of rape, faces 10-year sentence

image.altText: the legs and feet of a herd of elephants

props.synopsis: When the elephants came, Kamal Rai ran for his life, but he slipped and fell. When he came to, he grabbed something nearby — not realising he'd wrapped his arms around a trunk.

title.children: 'The elephant started to spin his trunk': The farmers living side-by-side with herds of ravenous elephants

image.altText: A close up of a brown snake near a barrier on the side of a tennis match.

props.synopsis: Security and a snake catcher are called in after a slippery (and dangerous) customer slithers onto court in Brisbane.

title.children: Deadly brown snake interrupts tennis match at Brisbane International

image.altText: Rafael Nadal in a blue tank top and white hat plays a shot at the Brisbane International

props.synopsis: Even at 37 years of age and returning from hip surgery, Rafael Nadal is a picture of fitness that impressed tennis fans and rivals alike upon his return to court ahead of next month's Australian Open.

title.children: ‘Intense’: Returning Rafael Nadal leaves young gun impressed ahead of Brisbane International

image.altText: A photo portrait of Tom Wilkinson. He's wearing black spectacles, a teal shirt and beige suit. He's got short, grey hair.

props.synopsis: British actor Tom Wilkinson, known for his roles in The Full Monty and Michael Clayton, dies suddenly at home.

title.children: Oscar-nominated British actor Tom Wilkinson dies at 75

image.altText: woman wearing a face mask that says "I am michael" next to flowers and an urn with "Michael S Lee" and dates etched on it

props.synopsis: With nowhere to turn domestically, families of victims killed in the Philippines' bloody war on drugs hope the International Criminal Court investigation will bring justice.

title.children: Jane believes her husband was a casualty of the Philippines 'war on drugs'. She hopes a 'court of last resort' will provide justice

image.altText: A composite of three images: England goalkeeper Mary Earp in a jersey, King Charles in a suit, and Shirley Bassey

props.synopsis: More than 1,000 celebrities and everyday people across the UK are recognised for their achievements and services.

title.children: Goalkeeper Mary Earps and singer Shirley Bassey among hundreds on King Charles's New Year Honours list

image.altText: Tina Holt in her home decorated by paintings she has created herself.

props.synopsis: For decades, housing development in suburban Australia has favoured large family homes with backyards, but experts say there's a growing need for one and two-bedroom dwellings.

title.children: Australians dream of owning a three-bedroom home, but is it what our housing market needs?

image.altText: Composite image of food in plastic containers and thermal paper receipt

props.synopsis: Shopping dockets? You are probably better off not handling them. Microwaving food in plastic? That is also not advised — and it is because of the 'disrupting' chemicals, which experts say are affecting vital systems in the human body.

title.children: 'Don't ever reheat it in the plastic container': Tips to avoid endocrine-disrupting chemicals that are all around us

image.altText: The backs of three people standing in the dark, watching fire and lava spew in a line from a volcanic eruption

props.synopsis: Despite hazardous incidents and some fatalities, visiting active volcanoes is a popular pastime for some.

title.children: Hooked on volcanoes? 'Lava chasing' tourists vie to catch Iceland's spectacular eruptions

image.altText: An older Pakistani man sits at a desk in front of the Pakistani flag.

props.synopsis: Pakistan's election body has rejected former prime minister Imran Khan's nomination to contest the 2024 national elections in two constituencies.

title.children: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan disqualified from 2024 elections

image.altText: A close-up, side profile image of Sam Bankman-Fried smirking as he walks past a car in a suit

props.synopsis: US prosecutors say the strong public interest in a prompt resolution of their fraud case against the former billionaire — who faces decades in prison — outweighs any benefits of a second trial.

title.children: Sam Bankman-Fried will not face a second trial, prosecutors say

image.altText: A plastic wrapped contained with extensive barnacle growth on the sand

props.synopsis: A total of 124 kilograms of cocaine has been found in sealed packages scattered along the coastline by members of the public over the past week.

title.children: Police warn people searching beaches for cocaine after two people rescued

image.altText: someone using a tattoo gun with black gloved hands on a forearm

props.synopsis: A tattoo can be a large investment in time, money and pain. Here's how to protect it over the summer.

title.children: Why summer can be a bad time to get a new tattoo

image.altText: A group of people celebrate next to the water, with Sydney Opera House in the background lit up by fireworks.

props.synopsis: Here's everything you should know about planning your trip to central Sydney to celebrate the arrival of 2024, including how to get there and the best vantage points to see the fireworks displays.

title.children: Your guide to watching the Sydney Harbour New Year's Eve fireworks

image.altText: Ksenia Fadeyeva posting for a picture next to Alexei Navalny

props.synopsis: An associate of imprisoned Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny has been sentenced to nine years' prison in the Kremlin's latest crackdown on dissent.

title.children: Associate of Russian opposition leader Navalny sentenced to nine years' prison for 'extremism'

image.altText: A group of men with backs to the camera working on the side of a wooden vessel on a hardstanc

props.synopsis: The Batavia shipwreck, with its mutiny and murder, is ingrained in Western Australian history. Now, 400 years later, a restoration project is bringing pride and new skills to a group of inmates.

title.children: Prisoners' pride in restoring a piece of infamous Australian maritime history

image.altText: A man wearing a black t-shirt standing in front of a brick wall.

props.synopsis: The cost of living, low rental vacancies and the housing crisis has forced more Australians into homelessness, putting immense strain on support services trying to help.

title.children: 'Worst year on record': How the cost of living crisis has changed the face of homelessness

image.altText: Two Australian batters run between the wickets during a women's ODI against India.

props.synopsis: After winning the series opener, Australia have posted a back-to-back victories with a win in the second ODI against India in Mumbai. Follow our ScoreCentre.

title.children: ODI live: Australia claim series win over India

image.altText: A lady is holding a drink in a dimly lit bar.

props.synopsis: Emily was 18 years old and out with friends at a Canberra nightclub when someone spiked her drink, and she was later sexually assaulted. Her story isn't unique, with spiking being chronically under-reported and hard to substantiate.

title.children: Emily's drink was spiked in a nightclub. Advocates say the crime is under-reported and hard to substantiate

image.altText: A single kangaroo in a paddock standing upright and looking at the camera from behind grass.

props.synopsis: An official survey estimates the roo population declined significantly across New South Wales in the past 12 months, yet farmers say numbers appear healthy.

title.children: Wildlife advocates, farmers at odds after NSW report shows kangaroo numbers down by two million

image.altText: A group of people gesturing at a giant swinging orange tie

props.synopsis: Billionaire Hermès heir Nicolas Puech is reportedly planning to bequeath part of his fortune to his gardener. It comes more than a decade after he walked away from the fashion company following a rival label's failed takeover bid.

title.children: He walked away from the family firm with $17b. Now this Hermès descendant has a plan for his riches

image.altText: Piles of blackened logs in the middle of a black forest.

props.synopsis: How has fire management changed since that fateful summer four years ago, when bushfires wiped out a third of the softwood forestry plantation in the Snowy Mountains?

title.children: Timber communities scarred by Black Summer fear they cannot afford another catastrophic fire

image.altText: Alex Chidiac claps her hands after the Matildas played England in the FIFA Women's World Cup semifinal.

props.synopsis: As they chase a fourth A-League Women title, the Victory receive a boost with Australia international Alex Chidiac signing with the club on a long-term deal.

title.children: Matildas midfielder rejoins Melbourne Victory after overseas stint

image.altText: Teddies being restored after the Cairns 2023 floods.

props.synopsis: Many sentimental items are lost when floods devastate towns. But in Cairns, much-loved childhood keepsakes are being rescued and restored by a group of caring volunteers.

title.children: How a teddy day spa is saving flood-damaged childhood treasures from ending up in the tip

image.altText: The road to Gan Gan in the NT.

props.synopsis: Meat is going off as power systems fail and asbestos is blowing about these NT indigenous homelands.

title.children: 'They can't go home': Indigenous homelands fall into disrepair as crime in towns soar

image.altText: An aerial view of the small NT town of Larrimah.

props.synopsis: Years after one of its dozen residents vanished without a trace, a Netflix documentary is bringing a global audience of millions to the mystery that looms over the remote Northern Territory town of Larrimah.

title.children: How a tiny Aussie outback town became a global true-crime phenomenon

image.altText: Donald Day and his wife Sabrina

props.synopsis: An American extremist linked to the Wieambilla killers claims he wished he had joined in on their massacre of Queensland police officers, a US court hears.

title.children: Inside the violent history of the US sovereign citizen linked to the Wieambilla police killings
